page.title: 20 Rural Conservation
page.content: This area has a large number of footpaths which are clearly marked on the maps & on signposts put up by the local council. Unfortunately,they have a habit of disappearing,usually into a field of growing rape or corn. A greater threat to the countryside are the disappearing hedgerows. Large fields may be more efficient to farm, but the practise of tearing down hedges not only changes the look of the countryside but presents a threat to the wildlife of the county. Hedgerows provide a habitat for many different kinds of mammals & insects.When the hedgerows disappear the wildlife may disappear with them. One of the most attractive features of this area is the rolling countryside with its small fields and colourful hedgerows. We hope it will not be lost for future generations to enjoy.
